intro: Digitaria parva, commonly known as small Digitaria, is a small annual grass native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its hardiness and adaptability, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
